tagline: Festival racing on California's Central Coast. Where gravel meets expo madness.

course.terrain_type: Former military base fire roads and coastal gravel
course.terrain_surface: Hardpacked fire roads, sandy sections, some technical connectors
course.signature_challenge: The distraction. There's so much happening at Sea Otter that the race can feel secondary. Stay focused or get caught up in expo madness.
course.character: Fast fire roads with coastal character. More about the experience than pure gravel suffering.

suffering_zones.label: Fort Ord Rollers
suffering_zones.desc: The terrain starts testing your legs.

suffering_zones.label: Sandy Sections
suffering_zones.desc: Beach proximity means sand. Momentum matters.

suffering_zones.label: Final Push
suffering_zones.desc: Tired legs, dusty conditions, festival finish awaits.

course.climate_description: April brings mild coastal weatherâ€”fog possible in morning, clearing to pleasant afternoons

biased_opinion.summary: Sea Otter gravel is best understood as part of the larger festival experience. If you want a pure gravel race, look elsewhere. If you want to race gravel AND attend North America's biggest bike expo, this is your event.

logistics.parking: Laguna Seca parking requires pass or shuttle. Plan accordingly.
logistics.registration: Opens fall prior. Cost: ~$125 race entry

searchable_text: Sea Otter Classic Gravel Festival racing on California's Central Coast. Where gravel meets expo madness. Fast fire roads with coastal character. More about the experience than pure gravel suffering. The distraction. There's so much happening at Sea Otter that the race can feel secondary. Stay focused or get caught up in expo madness.
